strings.Value: [Leave] "Don't mention it. Take care."
"Judging by your fight with that owlbear, Mivoni 'swordlords' couldn't best one of our cooks. Would you like some lessons in swordplay from my stablehand?"
"I apologize. It was a poor joke."
[Attack] "Satisfaction? If that's your wish. Defend yourselves!"
"It almost killed you!"
"How are things in Mivon?"
"Mivon's public officials are determined by duels?"
[Attack] "Let's see how Mivoni swordlords fight. On your guard!"
"Yes, that sounds like fun! I'll consider it."
"What, you want to try taking the throne from me, Reg?"
"Why would I? We have the perfect state system. I'm in charge, and you're my right hand — why change anything?"
"Your business is fighting, not state governance."
{n}The sisters glance at each other, grimacing. Finally, Edna straightens herself and speaks.{/n} "Thank you. We owe you our lives."
"Were we not your guests, I would demand satisfaction here and now!" {n}Edna hisses through clenched teeth, glaring.{/n} "I urge you to rescind your words, before I'm forced to make you do so!"
"In {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g}, that sort of joke typically ends with an appointment in the square and the jester finding a few new buttonholes in their shirt," {n}Edna responds coldly.{/n}
"That's because SOMEONE would happily charge a pack of dragons with their bare hands, given the chance!"
"Hear that, Sister? 'Take care.' As in, make sure we can actually kill a monster before attacking it!"
"Oh? And here I thought it was because ONE OF US spends more time running to the kitchen for cookies than training with her sword!"
{n}The sisters glare at each other, their teeth clenched.{/n}
"The most dangerous monster YOU could handle is a cow — that's already been butchered and deep-fried! You should make yourself a new coat of arms with a fork instead of a sword on it!"
{n}The sisters continue to quarrel, no longer paying attention to you.{/n}
{n}The sisters are still here, blaming each other for the fiasco with the monster.{/n}
{n}The sisters can barely manage to bid you farewell before they resume their quarrel.{/n}

"The same as always — a total mess. As far as I can tell, {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} officials must have decided state prisons were a waste of taxes, because their criminals have been fleeing to our lands by the dozens. And {g|Galt}Galt{/g} is sending spies and provocateurs at us without even trying to cover their tracks anymore. Add in yet another skirmish along our border with {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g} and... well, it's business as usual."
"On the bright side, our uncle has finally defeated the old treasurer in a duel. So now, as long as no one else tries to claim the position, it's as good as his!"
"It's called meritocracy — the most skilled get to rule! Anyone can gain a high position in our society, provided they can defend that position in a fair fight."

"Everyone duels, from lowly apprentices to high ministers. That's why {g|Mivon}Mivoni{/g} swordplay is unrivaled — not by {g|Galt}Galt{/g}, not by {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}, and not by the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}!"
"It is not Edna's pride or Julia's sloth that will be their undoing — it is their mutual inability to cooperate... Not that it is any of my business."
"Duels... Reckless games with death, where players bet their lives to satisfy their vanity and hubris. Silly, really — but are our entire lives not the same?"
"Big deal, fencing with toothpicks! Just some entertainment for rich city dwellers. In a real fight, all your stances and feints aren't worth shit!"

"{g|Mivon}Mivon's{/g} like a paradise for bards. There are duels every day, and of course, the winners want songs of their victories. So bards will prepare a dozen songs in advance, and then just slip the right name in!"
"Fun ways they have here! Maybe we should introduce some of their rules into our barony, huh?"
"What? No way. Why would I need your throne? I just thought it would be fun."
"Ha ha, that's right! We've got the best barony in all the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}!"

"It'd be great! You want to be a minister? Learn to swing a sword, not just a pen! You want to sit in someone else's chair? Put a bear trap on it! You want... Wait, no. That's just nonsense. It'd end up just like the damned {g|Technic League}Technic League{/g}. To hells with it, let's just keep things as they are."
{n}The half-orc purses his lips, frowns, and looks to the ground.{/n}
